title: Ticket #2567: Priority and preemption not working correctly
description:
I'm reproing this on 7_6-branch head: 4eaaaaf2413d4ae0133e8b34a0c34aff646414ff

Repro with this config: 

MAXJOBRETIREMENTTIME = 3600
PREEMPT = True
PREEMPTION_REQUIREMENTS = True
RANK = 0
NEGOTIATOR_CONSIDER_PREEMPTION = True

CLAIM_WORKLIFE = 0

NEGOTIATOR_INTERVAL = 30
NEGOTIATOR_DEBUG = D_FULLDEBUG

NUM_CPUS = 5

First set prio-factor for "u1" 

[eje@rorschach grid]$ condor_userprio -setfactor u1@localdomain 10
The priority factor of u1@localdomain was set to 10.000000

Next submit five jobs (all slots) against "u1" (10 minute duration) 

universe = vanilla
cmd = /bin/sleep
args = 600
should_transfer_files = if_needed
when_to_transfer_output = on_exit
+AccountingGroup="u1"
queue 5

Wait for those five jobs to start running. Now submit another job for user "u2" - this user should have better priority since its prio-factor is just 1.0 

universe = vanilla
cmd = /bin/sleep
args = 60
should_transfer_files = if_needed
when_to_transfer_output = on_exit
+AccountingGroup="u2"
queue 1

Let a few negotiator cycles pass. We expect job for "u2" to preempt somebody from "u1" but it does not happen: 

[eje@rorschach grid]$ condor_q


-- Submitter: rorschach.localdomain : <192.168.1.2:35245> : rorschach.localdomain
 ID      OWNER            SUBMITTED     RUN_TIME ST PRI SIZE CMD
   3.0   eje            10/20 16:31   0+00:03:09 R  0   0.0  sleep 600
   3.1   eje            10/20 16:31   0+00:03:09 R  0   0.0  sleep 600
   3.2   eje            10/20 16:31   0+00:03:09 R  0   0.0  sleep 600
   3.3   eje            10/20 16:31   0+00:03:09 R  0   0.0  sleep 600
   3.4   eje            10/20 16:31   0+00:03:09 R  0   0.0  sleep 600
   4.0   eje            10/20 16:32   0+00:00:00 I  0   0.0  sleep 60

6 jobs; 1 idle, 5 running, 0 held

Note priorities appear as we'd expect: 

[eje@rorschach grid]$ condor_userprio -all -allusers
Last Priority Update: 10/20 16:35
                                    Effective   Real     Priority   Res   Total Usage       Usage            Last
User Name                           Priority  Priority    Factor    Used (wghted-hrs)    Start Time       Usage Time
------------------------------      --------- -------- ------------ ----  ----------- ---------------- ----------------
u2@localdomain                           0.50     0.50         1.00    0         0.03 10/20/2011 16:29 10/20/2011 16:32
eje@localdomain                          0.50     0.50         1.00    0         0.00 12/31/1969 17:00        ???
<none>                                   0.51     0.51         1.00    5         0.46 10/20/2011 16:29 10/20/2011 16:35
u1@localdomain                           5.11     0.51        10.00    5         0.43 10/20/2011 16:29 10/20/2011 16:35
------------------------------      --------- -------- ------------ ----  ----------- ---------------- ----------------
Number of users: 3                                                     5         0.46 10/20/2011 16:29        ???

analyze says "u2" is not running because other jobs have better priority, which makes no sense: 

[eje@rorschach grid]$ condor_q -bet 4.0


-- Submitter: rorschach.localdomain : <192.168.1.2:35245> : rorschach.localdomain
---
004.000:  Run analysis summary.  Of 5 machines,
      0 are rejected by your job's requirements
      0 reject your job because of their own requirements
      5 match but are serving users with a better priority in the pool
      0 match but reject the job for unknown reasons
      0 match but will not currently preempt their existing job
      0 match but are currently offline
      0 are available to run your job
remarks:
2011-Oct-21 10:44:59 by eje:
Ugh, it's not broken, it wasn't preempting because I set "PREEMPT = TRUE" and the first five jobs were going into Claimed/Retiring, with max retirement time of 1 hour.

Works fine with 

MAXJOBRETIREMENTTIME = 0
PREEMPT = False
creator: eje
